caption.center: STANLEY W. McKINLEY, MOVANT/APPELLANT, v. STATE OF MISSOURI,

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District,

date.center: Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied June 17, 1992.

opinion.posture: APPEAL FROM THE CIRCUIT COURT, ST. LOUIS COUNTY; MELVYN W. WIESMAN, JUDGE.
opinion.attorneys:
Cheryl Rafert, Sindel Sindel, Clayton, David C. Hemingway, St. Louis, for movant, appellant.
William L. Webster, Atty. Gen., Robert Alan Kelly, Asst. Atty. Gen., Jefferson City, for respondent, plaintiff.
opinion.opinion_text:
[1] Movant appeals from an order denying his 24.035 motion on the merits without an evidentiary hearing. The motion court's judgment is based on findings of fact that are not clearly erroneous.
[2] No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum opinion for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.
[3] The judgment is affirmed in accordance with Rule 84.16(b).
